citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation
citeinfo.title: COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_DNR_IN.SHP: Underground Coal Mine Entrances in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation, Point Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

citeinfo.othercit:
NOTE: An Esri file geodatabase named "CMIS_GDB_MAIN.MDB" (containing the point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF") was originally provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey (IGS) personnel on November 15, 2017, by personnel of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. It has been converted to an Esri point shapefile and has been named "COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_DNR_IN.SHP" to conform to naming conventions of the IGS. Also, portions of this metadata have adapted content that was originally authored by IDNR personnel.
This shapefile contains information that is related to two additional GIS datasets produced by the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation: 1) [COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_DNR_IN.SHP: Underground Coal Mines in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation, Polygon Shapefile)] and 2) [COAL_MINE_SURFACE_DNR_IN.SHP: Surface Coal Mines in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation, Polygon Shapefile)].

descript.abstract:
COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_DNR_IN.SHP contains the entrance locations of all documented underground coal mine entrances that have operated in the coal region of Indiana since the mid-1880s, up to December 31, 2016. COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_DNR_IN.SHP is attributed to allow the mine entrances to be differentiated based on entrance type (hoist shaft, other shafts, slope, unknown), depth, mine number, and source information (map number).
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR, Division of Reclamation, for the source point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF":
"Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN is a compilation of all documented underground coal mine entrances in Indiana. Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN was compiled by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) as part of a contract deliverable for the Abandoned Mine Lands program of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN incorporates mine entrance locations compiled as part of the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS), an integrated geographic information system (GIS) and database management system (DBMS) created to store, analyze, and help distribute coal mine data in Indiana. The system contains data for surface and underground coal mines that operated in Indiana from the mid-1830s to 2007. Original source information for Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN includes company mine maps, field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, and Reports of the Indiana State Mine Inspector. All mine data included in Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN are organized in a GIS using ESRI ArcGIS software of the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) on the Windows platform. Scale of source data ranges from 1:4,800 to 1:100,000."
descript.purpose:
This data provides access to an Esri point shapefile containing the most current information for coal mine entries in Indiana, as provided by personnel of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR, Division of Reclamation, for the source point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF":
"Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN was originally compiled by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) as part of a contract deliverable for the Abandoned Mine Lands program of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN incorporates mine entrance locations compiled as part of the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS), an integrated geographic information system (GIS) and database management system (DBMS) created to store, analyze, and help distribute coal mine data in Indiana. The system contains data for surface and underground coal mines that operated in Indiana from the mid-1830s to 2007. Original source information for Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN.SHP includes company mine maps, field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, and Reports of the Indiana State Mine Inspector. Scale of source data ranges from 1:4,800 to 1:100,000."

idinfo.native: Esri ArcGIS version 10.4 shapefile format, approximately 944 Kb

attracc.attraccr:
This data set was provided by IDNR personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR, Division of Reclamation, for the source point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF":
"The attribute values were checked to ensure that the values were within the range that should be expected based upon the values of the input data that were used to create the shapefile. Two tests for attribute consistency were performed using the QueryBuilder Tool in Esri ArcView: (1) Completeness of values was verified. No values were left blank. (2) Validity of values was verified. All features were attributed with values in the appropriate range and format."

dataqual.logic: Esri ArcInfo point topology is present
dataqual.complete:
This data set was provided by IDNR personnel and is assumed to be complete.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR, Division of Reclamation, for the source point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF":
"Coal mine entrances included in this shapefile were compiled by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) as part of a contract deliverable for the Abandoned Mine Lands program of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN incorporates mine entrance locations compiled as part of the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS), an integrated geographic information system (GIS) and database management system (DBMS) created to maintain spatial and tabular data related to coal mines in the Indiana portion of the Illinois Basin. The CMIS includes spatial mine data compiled from all known sources including: company mine maps (from the Indiana Division of Reclamation and from coal companies), field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, and reports of the State Mine Inspector. In compiling data for the CMIS, every effort was made to ensure data accuracy and completeness. However, it is known that undocumented mining has occurred in the study area. Also, because of inconsistency in source map quality and completeness, the actual locations of mine entrances may not coincide with the points as portrayed in this shapefile. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a specific site may differ from this shapefile."

horizpa.horizpar:
This preliminary data set was provided by IDNR personnel and is assumed to be horizontally accurate, per IDNR standards.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR, Division of Reclamation, for the source point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF":
"Mine entrances included in this shapefile were compiled from several sources having varying map scales. Thus, the horizontal positional accuracy of individual points may vary. If highly detailed mine entrance location information is needed, contact the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Divison of Reclamation for additional information. Because of inconsistency in source map quality and completeness, the actual location of mine entrances may not coincide with the points portrayed in this shapefile."

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the creation of these data. No quantitative tests were performed.

srcinfo.srccontr: Many mine entrances were added to the dataset from a variety of sources, all of which are listed in the attribute section of this document under the Mapnumb attribute field. The number of sources actually consulted is too great to list here. These sources also provided much of the attribute information found in the final dataset.
The majority of the mine entrances included in this dataset were originally digitized from the Mylar Underground Mine Quadrangle Maps.

CMIS mine data were updated with information collected in 2000 for the publication of the Directory of Coal Mines and Producers in Indiana - 2000. The update included three new underground mine entrances. The 2000 Coal Directory was not a source of new information, but rather a medium to distribute updated information obtained from the Coal Mine Information System.

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation
citeinfo.title: CMIS_GDB_MAIN.MDB - point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF" - Coal Mine Entries (as of December 31, 2016)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

srcinfo.srccontr: Coal mine entrance locations in Indiana, as of December 31, 2016.

procstep.procdesc: Mine entrances from a variety of sources including company mine maps, field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, and Reports of the State Mine Inspector were hand-plotted on 1:24,000-scale topographic maps. This data set, comprised of nearly 100 quadrangle maps, was compiled by IGS personnel in the mid-1980s to create the first complete compilation of mine entrance locations in Indiana. Although mine entrances were originally plotted on paper quadrangle maps, those work maps were soon replaced by a set of Mylar maps that constitute the suite of 1:24,000-scale Features Related to Subsidence Maps.

Entrance locations from the Mylar Indiana Geological Survey 1:24,000-scale subsidence maps were digitized by Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) personnel in the late 1980s as a component of the first coal mine GIS for the IGS and the Indiana Division of Reclamation. Points were digitized using ESRI PC ArcInfo and georeferenced using 8 tics from 1:24,000-scale topographic maps. Points were digitized, but no attribute information was associated with the points at that time.

Data from the early coal mine GIS (coal mine entry coverages) were converted to a new GIS format and updated with new mine data. Using ESRI ArcView version 3.1, points were extracted from the old GIS coverages and attributed with source information, entry type, depth, and symbol rotation angle. In addition, several historic and contemporary mine entrances were added to the dataset by reviewing an exhaustive list of various miscellaneous maps and publications. This effort was required to rectify positional errors and entry omissions discovered in the Coal mine entry coverages.
procstep.srcused: Coal mine entry coverage, Underground Mine Quadrangle Maps, Various miscellaneous maps and publications
procstep.srcprod: Coal_Entry shapefile (a component of the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS)

procstep.procdesc: The Coal Mine Information System CMIS mine data were updated with information collected for publication of the Directory of Coal Mines and Producers in Indiana - 2000. The update included three new underground mine entrances. The 2000 Coal Directory was not a source of new information, but rather a medium to distribute updated information obtained from the Coal Mine Information System.

County-based mine entrance shapefiles were combined to a regional shapefile using the merge function in ESRI ArcView's Geoprocessing Wizard. The resulting shapefile included all underground mine entrances in the Indiana coal region.

The Coal Mine Information System CMIS mine data were updated with active underground mine information collected annually from from the Indiana Bureau of Mines. In addition, several mine entrances were added or relocated by georeferencing recently scanned mine workings maps and reviewing mine entry locations. SW_COAL_ENTRY was imported to an ESRI personal geodatabase point feature class and renamed COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_IN.

COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_IN was obtained from the Indiana Geological Survey as part of a contract deliverable for the Abandoned Mine Lands program of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_IN was renamed to Coal_Mine_Entries_DNR_IN

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

procstep.procdesc: An Esri file geodatabase named "CMIS_GDB_MAIN.MDB" (containing the point feature class named "COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF") was originally provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey (IGS) personnel on November 15, 2017, by personnel of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. The feature class COAL_ENTRY_GEOREF was then converted to an Esri point shapefile and was renamed "COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_DNR_IN.SHP" to conform to naming conventions of the IGS. Also, portions of this metadata have adapted content that was originally authored by IDNR personnel.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) an MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

edom.edomvd: Vertical mine entrance (shaft); utilized for coal removal and entry of mine workers
edom.edomvds: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

edom.edomvd: Vertical mine entrance (shaft); secondary entrance utilized as an air or escape shaft
edom.edomvds: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation
Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

attr.attrdef: Depth of mine entrance below ground surface in feet (unknown depths are listed as -9999)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

attr.attrdef: Mine ID Number; unique number used to identify information related to a mine in the Coal Mine Information System database (-9999 indicates a record for which mine data is either unavailable or has yet to be been entered into the Coal Mine Information System GIS or tabular database)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

attr.attrdef: ID number used to identify source data used to determine location of mine entrance
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

attr.attrdef: Symbol rotation angle; a numeric value between 0 and 360 used in ArcGIS to rotate the slope entrance symbols to the approximate orientation of the actual mine entrances. The values were determined based on a value of 360 pointing due west and a value of 90 pointing due south. Note that Hoist, Other, and Unknown entry types are all attributed with values of 0 because those symbols don't need to be rotated.
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

attr.attrdef: Name of the county in which the site is located
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological and Water Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following citation should be included: [COAL_MINE_ENTRIES_IN.SHP: Underground Coal Mine Entrances in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Scale, 1:24,000, Point Shapefile), 20171115].
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGWS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGWS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
